You can add some text to describe what you did. Don't forget to insert your R code in a code chunk. When you generate your HTML, it will run your code.
Use URL to import your data. 


```{r,  eval=T}
library (tidyr)
library (dplyr)

rairuoho<-read.table('D:/R for class/rairuoho.txt', header=T, sep='\t', dec='.', na.strings = "n/a") # use the URL here 

rairuoho$row<-NULL
rairuoho$column<-NULL

rairuoho$treatment<-ifelse(rairuoho$treatment=='nutrient', 'enriched','water')

rairuoho_long <- rairuoho %>% pivot_longer(day3:day8,
                                           names_to = ("day"),
                                           values_to = "length")

#rairuoho_rename <-rename(rairuoho_long,c(day=name, lenghth=value))
finally <- rairuoho_rename %>% unite(upper_left, spatial1, spatial2, sep = " ")
finally
```
